value.title: Page Level Security workaround in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you want to control the access to the Power BI report pages (or tabs) in a way that some users see some pages, and some others see other pages, we need something called page-level security. However, Power BI, as of today, doesnâ€™t support visual-level or page-level security. There is a workaround to
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/an7n2kSTBk0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Architecture Best Practice
value.excerpt: Using Power BI is simple. However, using it properly needs a good architecture. In a multi-developer environment, the architecture of a Power BI implementation should allow multiple developers to work on the same solution at the same time. On the other hand, the Power BI architecture should be designed
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/P3_iRFVP4Eo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh and Hybrid Tables
value.excerpt: The default configuration for the Power BI dataset is to wipe out the entire data and reload it again. This can be a long process if you have a big dataset. Hybrid tables in Power BI keep part of the data in DirectQuery, and the rest is imported for data freshness and performance. In this video, I explain

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Understanding context transition
value.excerpt: Context transition is one of the most obscure topics for DAX newbies. Learn how it works, its effects, and how to leverage it rather than be scared of it. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751407?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Create a data-driven story with Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Power BI helps you create vibrant, highly useful reports that form a cohesive, data-driven story. Youâ€™ll learn how to use buttons, bookmarks, and other navigation techniques. Additionally, youâ€™ll learn how to integrate Power BI reports with other applications. Power BI visuals can interact with each other, letting the user see exactly which data is appealing to them. Youâ€™ll also explore Power BI report themes to create a unified reporting experience across all reports.

value.title: Explore data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Turn your business intelligence data into data insights by creating and configuring Power BI dashboards.

value.title: Work with Power BI visuals
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the userâ€™s attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).

value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query, the right way.
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  Link to the null, blank video mentioned in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoRjNx1G2g4

value.title: Forecasting in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we will learn how we can forecast our data in Power BI. We will be discussing which visualization supports forecasting in Power BI. We can perform forecasting with a Line chart in Power BI.  In this video, we have taken an example of a real-life scenario to forecast our data.  Stay Connected

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?
value.excerpt: During this session, we will try to resolve one of the most common issues that occur in Power BI Desktop which is Incorrect Measure Total issue for table or matrix visual. Sometimes, we have multiple tables in our report and we have prepared some DAX expression to calculate some values in our report.
